name: 3dPolyfit
author: AFNI Developers
description: Fits a polynomial in space to the input dataset and outputs that fitted dataset. You can also add your own basis datasets to the fitting mix.

inputs.description: Maximum polynomial order (0..9); [default=3]; [n=0 is the constant 1]; [n=-1 means only use volumes from '-base']
inputs.name: Polynomial order

inputs.description: Gaussian blur input dataset (inside mask) with FWHM='f' (mm)
inputs.name: Blur FWHM

inputs.description: Radius (voxels) of preliminary median filter of input; default is no blurring
inputs.name: Median filter radius

inputs.description: Use 'pp' for prefix of output dataset (the fit); default prefix is 'Polyfit'; use NULL to skip this output
inputs.name: Output prefix

inputs.description: Use 'rr' for the prefix of the residual dataset; default is not to output residuals
inputs.name: Residual prefix

inputs.description: Save coefficients of fit into text file cc.1D; default is not to save these coefficients
inputs.name: Coefficient output

inputs.description: Create a mask from nonzero voxels in 'mset'; default is not to use a mask
inputs.name: Mask dataset

inputs.description: Scale the mean value of the fit (inside the mask) to 1; probably this option is not useful for anything
inputs.name: Mean scale flag

inputs.description: Clip fit values outside the rectilinear box containing the mask to the edge of that box, to avoid weird artifacts
inputs.name: Clip box flag

inputs.description: Set 'mm' to 2 for least squares fit; set it to 1 for L1 fit [default method=2]; [Note that L1 fitting is slower than L2 fitting]
inputs.name: Fit method

inputs.description: In addition to the polynomial fit, also use the volumes in dataset 'bb' as extra basis functions
inputs.name: Base dataset

inputs.description: Print fun and useful progress reports
inputs.name: Verbose flag
